variant.question: When law enforcement officers carrying weapons are present on board, the State shall ensure that the..

options.text: pilot-in-command is notified about the number of armed persons and their seat location.
pilot-in-command is notified only about the number of armed persons.
aircraft operator is notified only about the number of armed persons.
aircraft operator is notified about the number of armed persons and their seat location.

variant.question: In accordance with Annex 17, what are the requirements when individuals who have been subject of judicial or administrative proceedings are required to travel?

options.text: The operator and PIC must be informed.
Inform the operator and request permission from the PIC.
Request permission from both the operator and the PIC.
Request permission from the operator and inform the PIC.

variant.question:
For security reasons, what objects listed below shall NOT be introduced, by any means whatsoever, on board an aircraft that is engaged in international civil aviation according to ICAO Annex 17?

1\. Weapons, the carriage of which is NOT authorised.   
 2\. Electronic devices with partially charged batteries.   
 3\. Explosives that may be used to commit an unlawful act.   
 4\. Liquids purchased outside of the airside zone of the aerodrome.

options.text: 1 and 3.
2 and 3.
1 and 4.

variant.question: When a passenger is obliged to travel due to judicial proceedings, each Contracting State shall ensure that

options.text: The aircraft operator and the pilot-in-command are informed.
The aircraft operator is asked for permission and the pilot-in-command is informed.
The aircraft operator and the pilot-in-command are asked for permission.
The pilot-in-command is informed.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 17, when a passenger is obliged to travel because he/she has been the subject of judicial proceedings, the Competent Authority shall ensure that the...

options.text: aircraft operator and the Pilot-in-Command are informed.
aircraft operator and the relevant ATC services are informed.
aircraft operator and the Civil Aviation Authority are informed.
relevant ATC services and the Pilot-in-Command are informed.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 17, what is the definition of ‘Security Control’?

options.text: A secret or public trial of an aviation security measure which simulates an attempt to commit an unlawful act.
A check on a person’s identity and previous experience including where legally permissible, any criminal history.
A means by which the introduction of weapons, explosives or other dangerous devices, articles or substances which may be used to commit an act of unlawful interference can be prevented.

The application of technical or other means which are intended to identify and/or detect weapons, explosives or other dangerous devices, articles or substances which may be used to commit an act of unlawful interference.

variant.question: What is true when an armed safety officer is to travel with a loaded firearm in accordance with their duties?

options.text: This requires a special authorization.
This does not require a special authorization.
The officer is not able to travel when armed.
The PIC shall not be informed.

variant.question: The carriage of weapons on a civil aviation aircraft is only allowed under certain conditions. Which of the following is a condition that permits a weapon to be carried on board?

options.text: When it is unloaded and stowed in a place inaccessible to any person during the flight.
When carried by a flight crew member, provided he/she holds a valid firearms permit.
When carried by in-flight security-officers without notification to the flight crew.
When carried by a professional hunter who holds a firearms permit with an ICAO endorsement.
